communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents pertaining to each Department's, each Division's, protocols, requirements, SOP's, regarding the payment of LAUSD contractors, day laborers, and vendors.
Scans in PDF format of the complete manual for software or all methods of payment transmittal. 
For instances where schools or the District (LAUSD) pays contractors, day laborers, vendors, in person or by mail I request documents scanned to PDF format displaying standard operating protocols, requirements, procedures as well. This should be done on a school by school basis with point of contact, and where all necessary by Department with point of contact.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Transfer/Transport of Captive-held  Marine Mammals
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act 5 U.S.C. § 552, I request all permit applications concerning the transfer/transport of captive-held marine mammals per the Marine Mammal Protection Act (P.L. 92-522) submitted from January l, 2019 to the present.

I respectfully request a waiver of all fees under 5 U.S.C. Section 552(a) (4) (A) (iii). As an academic researcher, I will actively share and provide access to these records with the public and my colleagues. Release of these materials is in the public interest, and will greatly contribute to public knowledge of U.S. Fish and Wildlife activities and formation of policy. I am happy to receive any and all records in electronic format. Please note that 5 U.S.C. Section 552(a) (4) (A) (iv) (II) requires that you provide the first 100 copies to me at no charge.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susan Maret

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NSA / Data Mining Reports (Annual)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act 5 U.S.C. § 552, I request the last two annual data mining reports submitted to Congress by NSA. Under the Federal Agency Data Mining Report Act, any department  or agency engaged in data mining is required to submit an annual updated report on this activity to Congress and to make the reports available to the public. The reports do not appear to be on the NSA website.

I respectfully request a waiver of all fees under 5 U.S.C. Section 552(a) (4) (A) (iii). As an academic researcher, I will actively share and provide access to these records with the public and my colleagues. Release of these materials is in the public interest, and will greatly contribute to public knowledge of U.S. governmental activities and formation of policy. Release of this records is not primarily in my commercial interest.

I am happy to receive any and all records in electronic format. Please note that 5 U.S.C. Section 552(a) (4) (A) (iv) (II) requires that you provide the first 100 copies to me at no charge.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susan Maret

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Clovis Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
